features: [New Wider Angle Upgrade] This updated product from Fosmon is perfect for a one or two car garage. The angle of the two lasers is widened up to 75 degrees, which can safely and efficiently assist two cars.

[Park Correctly and Easily Every Time] Do you have trouble about parking in a garage? Are you often too close to the side, too far forward, or too far back? Fosmon's dual laser parking assistant will allow you to park in the correct spot every time. With its simple installation and setup, the garage parking aid will be ready to use in minutes. No more busted bumpers and doors.
[Motion Activated Laser] The motion activated lasers have a detection range of 33 feet/10 meters, and will shut off after 30 seconds without motion.

[Provides Individual Laser Control] The garage parking aid allows for individual laser control for use with one parking stall or two. Simply toggle the button located on the side of the unit to switch between one or two lasers. The lasers have a 360-degree adjustment, ensuring that no matter the vehicle or parking spot size, the laser will be able to hit the mark each and every time.
[Battery Backup and Motion Activated] Even if the power goes out, the dual laser garage parking aid can use a 9v powered battery backup. NOTE: Battery not included.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Fosmon's Dual Laser Motion Activated Parking Assistant Makes Parking Easy Eliminate the risks that come with not parking correctly in an enclosed parking spot or garage. Fosmon's dual laser parking assistant will allow you to park in the correct spot every time. With its simple installation and setup, the garage parking aid will be ready to use in minutes. No more busted bumpers and doors. Battery Backup and Motion Activated Whether you are setting up one laser or two, the garage parking aid has a large motion sensor built in, allowing for the lasers to automatically turn on and off based on the movement of your vehicle. The lasers will turn off after 30 seconds of no movement. NOTE: Battery not included. Provides Individual Laser Control The garage parking aid allows for individual laser control for use with one parking stall or two. Simply flip the toggle button located on the side of the unit to turn on one laser or two. The lasers have a 360-degree adjustment, ensuring that no matter the vehicle or parking spot size, the laser will be able to hit the mark each and every time.
Package Includes: 1x Garage Parking Assistant1x 8ft. AC Adapter3x Mounting Anchors3x Mounting Screws2x Mounting Tapes1x User Manual

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product / Easy Install
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this parking laser guide knowing it would be a simple and uncomplicated product. I found the unit to be made very lightweight, however very sturdy. I mounted the unit onto the bottom of my garage door opener, since I wanted a cleaner install. We only have one car, so I mounted the unit sideways and use one laser for when I drive straight in and the other laser the other direction in case we back in. Both are aimed for a spot on the dashboard. The red laser is very bright and large enough even on the dark dashboard. I took a picture of it on the floor which is approximately 20 feet away from where it is mounted on the opener. Another reason I mounted the unit sideways was so that the sensor would be more sensitive on one side of the garage than on the other side, so I could go along my workbench area without activating it. The unit shuts off after approximately 30 seconds just as described. Definitely would buy this unit again. It wasn’t the least expensive and they all looked the same, but I figured you get what you pay for and this particular laser had lots of purchases with great reviews.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works great, really helps with parking. Wide angle options and range makes this great in a 2 car garage. Easy to install too

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works pretty good
reviews.reviewText: The light is plenty bright, and the unit is pretty easy to install. It's flimsy plastic, but honestly that doesn't matter after you get it mounted. The double sided mounting strip they include is a TOTAL JOKE. So use your own double sided tape to get a secure mounting. Other than that, it is working and doing exactly what I hoped: making it WAAAAY easier to ensure my car is pulled in enough to close the garage door--but not so much that I can't get around it easily (my wife insists on parking the car in my WOODSHOP! I know, right?)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is an expensive solution to a complex problem. Mainly my wife can't park straight. However, this in-expensive solution works really well and was installed with a phillips head screwdriver. Going straigt into the drywall is fine as the unit has very little weight.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great idea, but difficult to install and not practical for tight spaces.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this unit because it looks like a very good idea, but it did not work as well as I expected and a much simpler and cheaper solution works better for us.First, despite the "wide angle upgrade", the laser is not wide enough for two cars parked at a reasonable distance (e.g. 3 feet). It took me a great deal of time to try different locations, different angles but the best I could do is for the laser to aim at the center of one car, and the passenger side of another. The problem is that there is a center console in the car so I would sometime miss the small dot if it lands at the side of the console.Second, we need to turn the car to part park our second car in the garage so the front of the car will not stay at the same place, and not quite in parallel with the front of the garage. This makes it difficult for us to judge the distance when the red dot lands at different locations each time. I suppose with time we should be able to learn the good stopping points though.I was not quite happy with the product so I bought a "Camco AccuPark Vehicle Parking Aid" and I realized that I was solving a simple problem with a complex solution since that simple piece of plastic works way better than the laser. The biggest difference is that you do not have to look for the laser dot and the car will stop by itself when it reaches the "parking aid", so whereas you could bump into something when you are not paying attention to the laser, you will definitely not bump into the wall as long as you are not accelerating in the garage.... There is really no need for a catching the red dot game each time when you park.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Replace the Hanging Tennis Ball in your Garage with this Laser
reviews.reviewText: The Dual Laser Garage Parking Assist Guide System is a great solution to keep your car from smashing into your garage wall. It's easy to install and can be used for both a single and two-car garage. Goodby tennis ball.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Motion detector works well
reviews.reviewText: Once you set the spots the product worked as expected. Laser stays on for about 30 seconds so if you’re really slow parking you may lose the spot. We like it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Doesn't alway come on with motion and batteries don't last long
reviews.reviewText: These need to be installed and wired in. The battery doesn't last long. And motion doesn't work well when the battery gets low.But when it works it does a good job.
